channel.title: For Sale - PC Related

item.title: HP ML110 G7 tower server
item.author: invalid@example.com (demiurge3141)
item.dc:creator: demiurge3141
item.content:encoded:
A nice quiet little server, used when my microserver broke.
i3-2100, 6Gb ram, 1Tb HDD (wiped), comes with Windows SBS 2011 sticker if you want to install OS.

R:$100

item.title: Bamboo Pad
item.author: invalid@example.com (Skexis)
item.dc:creator: Skexis
item.content:encoded:
Wacom model CTH300K. Box contains the pad itself that stores a stylus and a wireless dongle. Compatable with Win 7 and 8 and Mac's (additional driver needed for OS X 10.7 and above). Runs on 2 x AAA batteries. Bought from the forums a while back on a whim but I've not used it so it has to go. $25 pp?

http://ocau.com/pix/3wcfa

http://ocau.com/pix/kevw2

Ins $60

item.title: MSI GTX 1050ti 4GB OC
item.author: invalid@example.com (goodguy82)
item.dc:creator: goodguy82
item.content:encoded:
My back up card. Perfect working condition.

Idle 30c and max load 60c

Never been OC, doesn't require much power to run it! Get 90 fps 1080p on Pubg!

Res: $190. Post $15 registered anywhere in Australia.

item.title: EVGA GTX 1070 Founder Edition

Evening OCAU,

to mod: I have another sales thread in here selling cooling gears, not sure if it's okay to have another sales thread for a different item as I want to sell them separately.

Item is still under warranty til August 2019, with the new EVGA RMA program I am happy to assist. Under water never seen above 60C in its life with the krakenG12 i have for sale in another thread. GDDR is samsung and OC to 4000 easily. Core can be 1900-2000 range too. Disclaimer: used for mining for 2hrs,...

item.title: 6700K + GTX1080ti Full System
item.author: invalid@example.com (Pesa)
item.dc:creator: Pesa
item.content:encoded:
Hey Guys,

Selling off one of my old systems that has recently been upgraded.
Purchased all from Scorptech around 11/16 so a little over a year old.
(Have receipts)
System has been running fine, upgraded due to just wanting a new build.
Never over clocked and has been sitting on my desk. Little dusty just needs a quick blow out.

Will see if i can sell the system as whole to start but can split off if need be.

Specs:

Intel Core i7 6700K
Corsair H110i Water Cooler
MSI Z170A MPOWER TITANIUM...

6700K + GTX1080ti Full System

item.title: 2x 1tb Samsung HD103UJ 3.5" HDDs, 8tb Seagate NAS HDD 3.5", Seagate 3.5" External USB 3.0 Enclosures

Hi all,

Got the following for sale. As usual, pickup from Melbourne CBD or Pascoe Vale much preferred over post.

Brilliant hard drives, although a bit old (made 2008). 7200rpm drives with 32mb cache.

CrystalDiskInfo:

Reserve/Instant: $30 each
Postage $10 per HDD

2. 8tb Seagate NAS HDD 3.5" 7200rpm
Another great hard drive, not to be mistaken for the budget Seagate...

2x 1tb Samsung HD103UJ 3.5" HDDs, 8tb Seagate NAS HDD 3.5", Seagate 3.5" External USB 3.0 Enclosures

item.title: Cooler, External HDD, cheap 120mm fans, i7-860
item.author: invalid@example.com (rubricae)
item.dc:creator: rubricae
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys,

Got a couple things laying around that I don't need anymore and may as well earn a few bucks off em.

1. Raijintek Pallas Low profile CPU cooler
Interesting cooler, similar to the cryorig C1 but cheaper and not quite as nice looking. Never actually used as I mounted it to my CPU only to find clearance issues with my mobo so had to find something else. incluides 140mm fan and all mounting gear, though note this is not AM4 compatible.

more info here:...

Cooler, External HDD, cheap 120mm fans, i7-860

item.title: x4 Cougar Vortex HDB 120mm Fans
item.author: invalid@example.com (fcyde)
item.dc:creator: fcyde
item.content:encoded:
Hey all,

Got x4 Cougar Vortex HDB CF-V12H 120mm fans for sale.

I've had these just sitting in my drawer for months. Bought them for a planned orange themed build, but ended up going in a different direction. Chose these because of the great performance and near silent levels.

More info: https://cougargaming.com/us/products/fans/vortex_hdb_fan/

Cost me $25ea at the time, will let them go for $40 all of them. Only willing to sell together.

PRICE: $40

Pickup...

x4 Cougar Vortex HDB 120mm Fans

item.title: Bad ass 3x 180 radiator & D5 vario pump
item.author: invalid@example.com (shane41)
item.dc:creator: shane41
item.content:encoded:
Anybody who knows me " knows I have a crapload of parts " Not as bad as Kelvin

1. Magicool radiator. This thing is magnificent. Cooled my 4790K & 7700K
on 1.5v. Believe me it was hammered on temps. Still I could run 80deg on the toughest benches
Great condition only use 20% Nylon coolant mix with distilled water.
Big big saving on radiators on the net x3 times the price.

$60pp what I paid in the forums

2. D5 vario pump had maybe 6 months use. El perfecto too. I just...

Bad ass 3x 180 radiator & D5 vario pump

item.title: Dell U2711 - $100 reserve
item.author: invalid@example.com (OnGsTa)
item.dc:creator: OnGsTa
item.content:encoded:
Just upgraded monitors so this is for sale. In excellent condition with no marks on screen or any dead pixels.
One minor issue it does have is: the right half on the screen will occasionally do a little flicker, where it kind of looks like that half will slightly shift very quickly.
I’ve only noticed with text on screen, it’s less noticeable when viewing photo/video.
It happens randomly so if I had to guess I’d say it might occur several times a day.

Reserve: $100
Will close this at 8pm...

Dell U2711 - $100 reserve

item.title: Swap 1070's for 1080Ti's
item.author: invalid@example.com (aussie-revhead)
item.dc:creator: aussie-revhead
item.content:encoded:
Ok boys, I listed my 1080Ti's for swap so I may as well try this way too. I have 6x Gainward GTX1070, no pic right now but I will attach one when I'm on the PC next. These are the "Herd Edition" type with 1x6 pin and 1x8 pin. All 6 are identical, I have had them mining for a couple of weeks with power level reduced and no overclock. I purchased them as a group from gumtree, no receipt or boxes, just the 6 video cards....

Swap 1070's for 1080Ti's
